definitions.definition: A type of coarse cloth , woven from hemp , useful for making sails and tents or as a surface for paintings .

examples: She is painting a moonlight scene on the canvas .

subdefinitions.definition: A piece of canvas cloth stretched across a frame on which one may paint.

definitions.definition: A mesh of loosely woven cotton strands or molded plastic to be decorated with needlepoint , cross-stitch , rug hooking , or other crafts.
( figuratively ) A basis for creative work.
examples: The author takes rural midwestern life as a canvas for a series of tightly woven character studies

definitions.definition: ( computer graphics ) A region on which graphics can be rendered .

examples: He spent the night under canvas .

definitions.definition: A rough draft or model of a song, air , or other literary or musical composition ; especially one to show a poet the measure of the verses he is to make.

main_definition: A type of coarse cloth , woven from hemp , useful for making sails and tents or as a surface for paintings .

A rough draft or model of a song, air , or other literary or musical composition ; especially one to show a poet the measure of the verses he is to make.
